definition: to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: He has but a handful of men with him, and armies will be despatched against him.
sentences.chinese: 他只带了几个人来，而我们会派军队去剿灭他的。

sentences.english: NATO, Afghans claim to kill 130 Taliban in Kunduz .
sentences.chinese: 北约和阿富汗声称在昆都士剿灭130个塔利班成员。

sentences.english: What if there are fifty righteous people in the city?
sentences.chinese: 假若那城里有五十个义人，你还剿灭那地方吗？

sentences.english: They eventually tamed the seas, domesticating or killing all the dangerous predators.
sentences.chinese: 他们征服了海洋，驯化或剿灭了所有危险的捕食动物。

sentences.english: Flee to the mountains or you will be swept away!
sentences.chinese: 要往山上逃跑，免得你被剿灭。

sentences.english: Negotiations with Russia fix the Central Asian frontier, and doom the Mongols.
sentences.chinese: 与俄罗斯斡旋确立中亚边境以及剿灭蒙古人。

definition: remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to mount a punitive expedition against bandits
to betray one's party/to defect (from the communist party)/renegade faction
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to send armed forces to suppress
